data_center.highlight: Blackwell Data Center revenue grew 17% sequentially

gaap.notes: Includes $180M release of previously reserved H20 inventory

adjusted_non_gaap.notes: Excludes H20 related charges/releases and the associated tax impact

h20_related.notes: Release stems from excess H20 inventory; no H20 sales to China in the quarter

other_items: Stock-based compensation and acquisition-related costs are excluded from the non-GAAP totals
Gains/losses from investments and debt amortization are the remaining reconciling items

revenue.notes: Assumes no H20 shipments to China

operating_expenses.notes: Full-year operating expense growth expected in the high-30% range

other_income_expense.notes: Excludes gains/losses from non-marketable and publicly-held equity securities

data_center: Blackwell Ultra production is ramping with extraordinary demand and NVLink rack-scale computing is enabling large-scale reasoning workloads
Introduced Spectrum-XGS Ethernet and expanded partnerships to build NVIDIA Blackwell AI infrastructure across France, Germany, Italy, Spain, and the U.K.
Collaborated on sovereign supercomputers such as Doudna, JUPITER, Blue Lion, Isambard, and FugakuNEXT
Delivered 1.5M tokens/sec for OpenAI’s gpt-oss-120b on NVL72 rack-scale systems
Partnered with Novo Nordisk and DCAI to advance drug discovery
gaming: Launched the Blackwell-powered GeForce RTX 5060, NVIDIA’s fastest-ramping x60-class GPU ever
DLSS 4 now available in over 175 games and apps, and GeForce NOW doubled its library to 4,500 titles via Install-to-Play
Collaborated with OpenAI to optimize new open-weight models for RTX GPUs and enable fast local inference through tools such as Ollama and llama.cpp
professional_visualization: Announced NVIDIA RTX PRO 4000 SFF Edition and RTX PRO 2000 Blackwell GPUs
Expanded the Siemens partnership to help digitalize the next-generation factory
Released new Omniverse libraries and SDKs to accelerate physical AI development
automotive_robotics: Delivered full production of the NVIDIA DRIVE AV platform and commenced initial shipments of NVIDIA DRIVE AGX Thor SoCs
Launched the NVIDIA Jetson AGX Thor developer kit and production modules for robotics at scale
Introduced the NVIDIA Halos full-stack safety platform and announced new NVIDIA Cosmos world foundation models for robotics
shareholder_actions: $24.3B returned to shareholders year-to-date via share repurchases and dividends
$14.7B remaining on the authorization; Board approved an additional $60B buyback without expiration
Next quarterly cash dividend of $0.01 per share scheduled for October 2, 2025
